panels.description: Number of seconds since Redis server start
panels.title: uptime

panels.description: Shard is up and running
panels.title: num redis shards up

panels.description:
Number of authentication failures.

Number of commands rejected because of access denied to a channel.

Number of commands rejected because of access denied to the command.

Number of commands rejected because of access denied to a key.
panels.title: auth denied

panels.description:
Number of value reallocations performed by active the defragmentation process.

Number of keys that were actively defragmented.

Number of keys that were skipped by the active defragmentation process.

Number of aborted value reallocations started by the active defragmentation process.
panels.title: active defrag

panels.description: The time passed since memory fragmentation last was over the limit, in milliseconds
panels.title: active defrag time

panels.description: The time passed since used_memory last rose above maxmemory, in milliseconds
panels.title: time since eviction exceeded

panels.description: Total number of dump payload deep integrity validations (see sanitize-dump-payload config).
panels.title: num dump payloads

panels.description: Total number of eventloop cycles
panels.title: number of eventloop cycles

panels.description:
Total time spent on executing commands in microseconds.

Total time spent in the eventloop in microseconds (including I/O and command processing).
panels.title: event loop duration

panels.description: Number of evicted clients due to maxmemory-clients limit.
panels.title: num evicted clients

panels.description: Total number of key expiration events
panels.title: num keys expired

panels.description: The percentage of keys probably expired
panels.title: keys probably expired

panels.description: The cumulative amount of time spent on active expiry cycles
panels.title: time spent in expiry cycles

panels.description: Number of evicted keys due to maxmemory limit.
panels.title: num evicted keys

panels.description: Number of commands processed per second
panels.title: commands rate

panels.description: Average time spent in a single eventloop cycle in microseconds
panels.title: avg cycle duration

panels.description: The count of times that active expiry cycles have stopped early
panels.title: num expiry cycles stopped early

panels.description: Number of eventloop cycles per second
panels.title: num cycles

panels.description:
The network's read rate per second.

The network's read rate per second in KB/sec for replication purposes.
panels.title: network io read

panels.description:
The network's write rate per second in KB/sec.

The network's write rate per second in KB/sec for replication purposes
panels.title: network io write

panels.description: The network's read rate per second
panels.title: network io read

panels.description: Duration of the latest fork operation in microseconds
panels.title: latest fork duration

panels.description: Number of read events processed by the main and I/O threads.
panels.title: io thread reads

panels.description: Number of write events processed by the main and I/O threads
panels.title: io thread writes

panels.description:
Number of successful lookup of keys in the main dictionary.

Number of un-successful lookup of keys in the main dictionary.
panels.title: key hits

panels.description: The number of sockets open for MIGRATE purposes
panels.title: num open sockets for MIGRATE

panels.description: Global number of pub/sub channels with client subscriptions
panels.title: num pub sub channels

panels.description: Global number of pub/sub pattern with client subscriptions
panels.title: num pub sub patterns

panels.description: Global number of pub/sub shard channels with client subscriptions
panels.title: num pubsub shards

panels.description: Number of connections rejected because of maxclients limit
panels.title: num rejected clients

panels.description: The number of full resyncs with replicas
panels.title: num full resyncs with replicas

panels.description:
The number of denied partial resync requests.

The number of accepted partial resync requests.
panels.title: num partial syncs with replicas

panels.description: The number of keys tracked for expiry purposes (applicable only to writable replicas)
panels.title: num keys tracked for expiry

panels.description:
Total number of output buffer expands.

Total number of output buffer shrinks.
panels.title: output buffer

panels.description: Total time memory fragmentation was over the limit, in milliseconds
panels.title: total defrag time

panels.description: Total number of commands processed by the server
panels.title: total commands processed

panels.description: The number of keys tracked for expiry purposes (applicable only to writable replicas)
panels.title: num keys tracked for expiry

panels.description: Total number of issued error replies, that is the sum of rejected commands (errors prior command execution) and failed commands (errors within the command execution)
panels.title: total error replies

panels.description: Total time used_memory was greater than maxmemory since server startup, in milliseconds
panels.title: total eviction time exceeded

panels.description: Total number of fork operations since the server start
panels.title: total forks

panels.description:
Total number of fork operations since the server start.

The total number of bytes read from the network for replication purposes.
panels.title: total network in

panels.description:
The total number of bytes written to the network.

The total number of bytes written to the network for replication purposes.
panels.title: total network out

panels.description: Total number of read events processed
panels.title: total reads

panels.description: Total number of write events processed
panels.title: total writes

panels.description: Number of items, that is the sum of clients number for each key, that are being tracked
panels.title: total tracking items

panels.description: Number of keys being tracked by the server
panels.title: total tracked keys

panels.description: Number of unexpected error replies, that are types of errors from an AOF load or replication
panels.title: total unexpected error replies

panels.description: Number of tracked prefixes in server's prefix table (only applicable for broadcast mode)
panels.title: total tracked prefixes

panels.description: Flag indicating AOF logging is activated
panels.title: aof enabled

panels.description: Flag indicating a AOF rewrite operation is on-going
panels.title: aof rewrite in progress

panels.description: Flag indicating an AOF rewrite operation will be scheduled once the on-going RDB save is complete.
panels.title: aof rewrite scheduled

panels.description: Number of AOF rewrites performed since startup
panels.title: num aof rewrites

panels.description: Duration of the on-going AOF rewrite operation if any
panels.title: on-going aof rewrite duration

panels.description: Duration of the last AOF rewrite operation in seconds
panels.title: last aof rewrite duration

panels.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write memory during the last AOF rewrite operation
panels.title: last copy-on-write aof rewrite

panels.description: Number of AOF rewrites that failed consecutively
panels.title: num aof rewrites failed consecutively

panels.description: Architecture (32 or 64 bits)
panels.title: server architecture bits

panels.description:
The server's configured frequency setting.

The server's current frequency setting.
panels.title: cpu hz

panels.description: Flag indicating if I/O threads are active
panels.title: is io threads active

panels.description: Flag indicating replication backlog is active
panels.title: replication backlog active

panels.description: Number of connected replicas
panels.title: num connected slaves

panels.description:
The server's current replication offset.

The offset up to which replication IDs are accepted.
panels.title: offset

panels.description: The master offset of the replication backlog buffer
panels.title: master offset

panels.description:
Size in bytes of the data in the replication backlog buffer.

Total size in bytes of the replication backlog buffer.
panels.title: backlog size

panels.description: Currently loading replication data-set asynchronously while serving old data. This means repl-diskless-load is enabled and set to swapdb.
panels.title: num async loading

panels.description:
Number of keys processed by the current save operation.

Number of keys at the beginning of the current save operation
panels.title: num current save keys

panels.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write memory while a child fork is running
panels.title: on-going copy-on-write memory

panels.description: The age, in seconds, of the current_cow_size value.
panels.title: age of current copy-on-write value

panels.description: Currently loading replication data-set asynchronously while serving old data. This means repl-diskless-load is enabled and set to swapdb.
panels.title: num async loading

panels.description: The peak size in bytes of copy-on-write memory while a child fork is running
panels.title: peak copy-on-write memory

panels.description: Flag indicating if the load of a dump file is on-going
panels.title: on-going loading

panels.description: Flag indicating a module fork is on-going
panels.title: on-going module fork

panels.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write memory during the last module fork operation
panels.title: copy-on-write memory of last module fork

panels.description: Flag indicating a RDB save is on-going
panels.title: rdb save on-going

panels.description: Number of changes since the last dump
panels.title: num changes since last save

panels.description: Duration of the on-going RDB save operation if any
panels.title: rdb bgsave duration

panels.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write memory during the last RDB save operation
panels.title: copy-on-write memory last save

panels.description: Number of RDB snapshots performed since startup
panels.title: num rdb saves

panels.description: Number of volatile keys deleted during the last RDB loading
panels.title: num volatile keys deleted during last load

panels.description: Number of keys loaded during the last RDB loading
panels.title: num keys loaded in last load

panels.description: The total amount of memory that the Redis host has
panels.title: total system

panels.description: Total number of bytes allocated by Redis using its allocator (either standard libc, jemalloc, or an alternative allocator such as tcmalloc)
panels.title: memory used

panels.description: The size in bytes of the dataset (used_memory_overhead subtracted from used_memory)
panels.title: dataset

panels.description: The sum in bytes of all overheads that the server allocated for managing its internal data structures
panels.title: memory overhead

panels.description: When activedefrag is enabled, this indicates whether defragmentation is currently active, and the CPU percentage it intends to utilize.
panels.title: active defrag running

panels.description: Total bytes in the allocator active pages, this includes external-fragmentation.
panels.title: memory allocator active

panels.description: Total bytes allocated form the allocator, including internal-fragmentation. Normally the same as used_memory.
panels.title: memory allocator allocated

panels.description: Delta between allocator_active and allocator_allocated. See note about mem_fragmentation_bytes.
panels.title: memory allocator frag

panels.description: Total resident memory (RSS)
panels.title: total resident memory

panels.description: Delta between allocator_resident and allocator_active
panels.title: memory allocator resident

panels.description: Ratio between allocator_resident and allocator_active. This usually indicates pages that the allocator can and probably will soon release back to the OS.
panels.title: memory allocator resident ratio

panels.description: Ratio between allocator_active and allocator_allocated. This is the true (external) fragmentation metric (not mem_fragmentation_ratio).
panels.title: memory allocator frag ratio (external)

panels.description: The number of objects waiting to be freed (as a result of calling UNLINK, or FLUSHDB and FLUSHALL with the ASYNC option)
panels.title: num lazyfree pending objects

panels.description: The number of objects that have been lazy freed.
panels.title: num lazyfree objects

panels.description: Transient memory used for AOF and AOF rewrite buffers
panels.title: aof transient memory buffers

panels.description: Delta between used_memory_rss and used_memory. Note that when the total fragmentation bytes is low (few megabytes), a high ratio (e.g. 1.5 and above) is not an indication of an issue.
panels.title: fragmentation

panels.description: Memory used by normal clients
panels.title: clients normal

panels.description: Memory used by replica clients - Starting Redis 7.0, replica buffers share memory with the replication backlog, so this field can show 0 when replicas don't trigger an increase of memory
panels.title: clients slaves

panels.description: Memory used by links to peers on the cluster bus when cluster mode is enabled.
panels.title: cluster links

panels.description: Ratio between used_memory_rss and used_memory. Note that this doesn't only includes fragmentation, but also other process overheads (see the allocator_* metrics), and also overheads like code, shared libraries, stack, etc.
panels.title: fragmentation ratio

panels.description: Used memory that's not counted for key eviction. This is basically transient replica and AOF buffers.
panels.title: not counted to evict

panels.description: Memory used by replication backlog
panels.title: replication backlog

panels.description: Total memory consumed for replication buffers
panels.title: replication buffers

panels.description: Delta between used_memory_rss (the process RSS) and allocator_resident
panels.title: rss overhead

panels.description: The number of EVAL scripts cached by the server.
panels.title: num cached scripts

panels.description: The number of functions
panels.title: num functions

panels.description: The number of libraries
panels.title: num libraries

panels.description: Ratio between used_memory_rss (the process RSS) and allocator_resident. This includes RSS overheads that are not allocator or heap related.
panels.title: rss overhead ratio

panels.description: Number of bytes used by the Lua engine for EVAL scripts
panels.title: lua

panels.description: Number of bytes overhead by the EVAL scripts (part of used_memory)
panels.title: memory used scripts eval

panels.description: Peak memory consumed by Redis
panels.title: peak memory used

panels.description: Number of bytes overhead by Function scripts (part of used_memory)
panels.title: functions memory

panels.description: used_memory_scripts_eval + used_memory_functions (part of used_memory)
panels.title: memory used scripts

panels.description: used_memory_vm_eval + used_memory_vm_functions (not part of used_memory)
panels.title: memory used vm

panels.description: Initial amount of memory consumed by Redis at startup in bytes
panels.title: memory used startup

panels.description: Number of bytes that Redis allocated as seen by the operating system (a.k.a resident set size). This is the number reported by tools such as top(1) and ps(1)
panels.title: memory used rss

panels.description: Number of bytes used by the script VM engines for Functions framework (not part of used_memory)
panels.title: memory used vm functions

panels.description: Number of bytes used by the script VM engines for EVAL framework (not part of used_memory)
panels.title: memory used vm eval

panels.description: System CPU consumed by the Redis server, which is the sum of system CPU consumed by all threads of the server process (main thread and background threads)
panels.title: sys cpu consumed

panels.description: System CPU consumed by the background processes
panels.title: sys cpu children

panels.description: System CPU consumed by the Redis server main thread
panels.title: sys cpu main thread

panels.description: System CPU consumed by the Redis server, which is the sum of system CPU consumed by all threads of the server process (main thread and background threads)
panels.title: sys cpu consumed

panels.description: User CPU consumed by the background processes
panels.title: user cpu children

panels.description: User CPU consumed by the Redis server main thread
panels.title: user cpu main thread

panels.description: Indicate Redis cluster is enabled
panels.title: num shards with cluster enabled

panels.description: Number of client connections to the specific shard
panels.title: num connected clients

panels.description: Number of blocking keys that one or more clients that would like to be unblocked when the key is deleted
panels.title: num blocked clients on no-key

panels.description: Number of clients being tracked (CLIENT TRACKING)
panels.title: num tracking clients

panels.description: Number of clients in the clients timeout table
panels.title: num clients in timeout

panels.description: An approximation of the number of sockets used by the cluster's bus
panels.title: num cluster connections

panels.description: Biggest input buffer among current client connections
panels.title: recent max input buffer

panels.description: Biggest output buffer among current client connections
panels.title: recent max output buffer

panels.description: Number of blocking keys
panels.title: num blocked keys

panels.description: The number of times the index has been used
panels.title: usage

panels.description: The number of documents
panels.title: documents

panels.description: The number of distinct terms
panels.title: terms

panels.description: The number of records
panels.title: records

panels.description: The percentage of the index that has been successfully generated (1 means 100%)
panels.title: indexed

panels.description: Indicates whether the index is currently being generated
panels.title: indexing

panels.description: The number of failures encountered during indexing
panels.title: indexing failures

panels.description: (PROVISIONAL) The number of errors encountered during indexing
panels.title: indexing errors

panels.description: The total number of cursors in the system
panels.title: cursor global

panels.description: The total time taken for indexing in seconds
panels.title: indexing time

panels.description: The total number of cursors open on the index
panels.title: cursor index

panels.description: The maximum number of cursors allowed per index
panels.title: cursor index capacity

panels.description: The number of idle cursors in the system
panels.title: cursor global idle

panels.description: The memory used by the vector index, which stores any vectors associated with each document
panels.title: vector index size

panels.description: (PROVISIONAL) The total memory used by the index, which is the sum of all the memory used by the index components.
panels.title: index size

panels.description: The memory used by the key table, which stores the mapping between document IDs and Redis keys
panels.title: key table size

panels.description: The memory used by the offset vectors, which store positional information for terms in documents
panels.title: offset vectors size

panels.description: (PROVISIONAL) The memory used by the tag overhead
panels.title: tag overhead size

panels.description: (PROVISIONAL) The memory used by the tag overhead
panels.title: text overhead size

panels.description: The memory used by the document table, which contains metadata about each document in the index
panels.title: doc table size

panels.description: The memory used by sortable values, which are values associated with documents and used for sorting purposes
panels.title: sortable values size

panels.description: The memory used by GEO-related fields
panels.title: geo shapes size

panels.description: The memory used by the inverted index, which is the core data structure used for searching in RediSearch. The size is given in megabytes.
panels.title: inverted index size

panels.description: The index deletion flag. A value of 1 indicates index deletion is in progress.
panels.title: cleaning

panels.description: The total time taken for indexing in seconds
panels.title: GC run

panels.description: The time in milliseconds taken by the last garbage collection run
panels.title: GC last run

panels.description: The number of numeric tree nodes whose changes were discarded due to splitting by the parent process during garbage collection
panels.title: GC numeric trees missed

panels.description: The total number of garbage collection cycles
panels.title: GC cycles

panels.description: The number of bytes collected during garbage collection
panels.title: GC collected

panels.description: The total number of blocks in the inverted index
panels.title: GC inverted index blocks count

panels.description: The number of blocks whose changes were discarded (skipped) because they were modified by the parent process during the garbage collection. Notably, as inverted index blocks are append-only, only the last block of an inverted index can be skipped.
panels.title: GC blocks denied
